content.question: A student obtains a liquid sample of green food coloring that is known to contain a mixture of two solid pigments, one blue and one yellow, dissolved in an aqueous solution of ethanol. Which of the following laboratory setups is most appropriate for the student to use in order to separate and collect a substantial sample of each of the two pigments?

choices.label: The figure presents a flask with a funnel lined with filter paper. There is a beaker filled with liquid that is being poured through the funnel into the flask.

The figure presents a bunsen burner with a round-bottom flask over the flame. The flask has a thermometer inserted into its neck. The side arm on the neck of the flask extends into a condenser. Liquid is dripping from the far end of the condenser into another container.

The figure presents a cylindrical container with a lid and filled with a shallow depth of liquid. A thin rectangular plate is positioned vertically upright inside the container. The plate has two dark circles, one on top of the other, in the middle part of the plate. The bottom part of the plate is in the liquid.

The figure presents a tube that is vertically positioned and with a stopcock and narrow tip at its lower end. An arrow indicates that fluid is moving from top to bottom in the tube, and then out through the narrow tip in a container. Two thin horizontal bands are visible at different heights in the tube.

content.answer: The figure presents a tube that is vertically positioned and with a stopcock and narrow tip at its lower end. An arrow indicates that fluid is moving from top to bottom in the tube, and then out through the narrow tip in a container. Two thin horizontal bands are visible at different heights in the tube.
